nodes

Interface MathNode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ASTNode, Visitable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssignmentNode, CubeNode, DifferenceNode, ProductNode, QuotientNode, SquareNode, SumNode

    public interface MathNode
extends ASTNode

    An interface used by expression-specific nodes inside the abstract syntax tree. It is implemented by difference-like, sum-like nodes.

    Author:
    Theodor Stoican

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSons(ASTNode node)
      A method that will be implemented inside every class that represents a MathNode.
      boolean canAddSons()
      A method that will be implemented inside every class that represents a math-type node.

      • Methods inherited from interface nodes.ASTNode

        getSons

      • Methods inherited from interface visitor.Visitable

        accept

    • Method Detail

      • addSons

        void addSons(ASTNode node)

        A method that will be implemented inside every class that represents a MathNode. It provides the possibility of adding a son to an expression-like node.

        Parameters:
        ASTNode - a node that implements the ASTNode interface and that will be added as a son

      • canAddSons

        boolean canAddSons()

        A method that will be implemented inside every class that represents a math-type node. It return a boolean, telling the programmer if they can or not add other sons.

        Parameters:
        none -
        Returns:
        boolean true-if there can be added more users and false-otherwise
